summary: Question for the Critical Role fandom how does one get into it cause its so big and so many episodes idk where to start. Also...
body: Question for the Critical Role fandom how does one get into it cause its so big and so many episodes idk where to start. Also wtf is going on cause I’ve seen so much about it in passing gif sets its not even funny lol well kinda, but still. Fun fact I actually gave Matthew Mercer pocky once at a convention it was awesome I wanted to ask him a question but I was too damn nervous. Hopefully some day I’ll see him again at some convention or another.

summary: Remember when after the blood pact episode Liam said during Talks that the cut palm to cut palm handshake didnt mean anything to...
body: Remember when after the blood pact episode Liam said during Talks that the cut palm to cut palm handshake didnt mean anything to Caleb except for the fact that it cleary meant something to Fjord and NOW, weeks and weeks after that, Caleb brought up the pact again and he was the one to offer his scarred palm to Fjord because he wanted him to know that he cares about him and that he understands him and his fears…

blog.name: c-is-for-circinate
blog.title: Only happy when it's complicated...
blog.description:
I'm C, which stands for a wide variety of things, including but not limited to 'coiled in a spiral with the tip hidden at the center'.  Take that metaphor as you will.

I like liking things.  I also like writing things and knitting things.  Sometimes I write things about TV shows I wish I didn't like.  Sometimes I don't like much of anything in the whole universe, and we have a Bad Brains day around here and that is fine.  Sometimes I just reblog a lot of posts about yarn.

tags: look if I did we'd end up with complex M9 poly knots
and someone would have a serious conversation about how Marion's a good person and a good therapist
but was kind of a shitty mom
in very specific ways for very specific reasons
because sometimes it happens that way
summary: I for sure need to run out the door, but dropping this wild plot bunny out into the world for y’all’s enjoyment: The Cerberus...
body:
I for sure need to run out the door, but dropping this wild plot bunny out into the world for y’all’s enjoyment:

The Cerberus Academy does make a connection between the name ‘Lavorre’ and Jester’s mother–maybe not right away when they get the Astrid letter, but definitely within the next 3-4 days after Episode 62, when the M9 and Caleb in particular make themselves known to the Scourgers in Xhorhas.

Edith, Luke, and Shakaste make it to Nicodranas right around the same time as Imperial forces, and the M9 have to jump there to help save them.  Chaos and fighting ensue.  Edith and Shakaste, who are effectively collateral bystanders, get out of the way and disappear a bit, but Nott grabs Luke to teleport back to Rosahna and safety–and Jester grabs a panicking, distraught Marian, right before Caleb brings the spell down around them and brings them all to the heart of the Bright Queen’s palace.

Now the M9 have a five-year-old kid that they can’t just pass off on a nice family in Hupperdook, running around the Xhorhaus and generally surrounded by their bad influences on all sides, and they’ve also got Jester’s mom.  Who, on one hand, has severe agoraphobia, hasn’t left the Lavish Chateau in years, and now just got dragged to the other side of the continent to a city where it’s always night and war is happening and everything is sort of terrifying and her entire career kind of just exploded, so that’s pretty fucking terrible and she’s going to have a rough time of it for a while.  And who, on the other hand, is perhaps the closest non-cleric thing Wildemount has to a freaking therapist.

I just want Caduceus soothing Marion over tea or perhaps alcohol, and Jester bringing her out onto the rooftop garden to see the plants, because the top of a tower isn’t really like being outside, and everybody trying to be so nice to Jester’s mom, intercut with Marion gradually realizing that everybody she’s living with now is a goddamn mess who desperately needs to be eased into talking about their own shit until they feel better.  Plus random background shenanigans of Luke Brennato, Age 5, in his brand new neighborhood, because that’s just fun.

Critical Role 2 ep 40

Wait. So, so far, there were two murals. One showing a flaming bird and the second is Uk'Otoa. So that means there’s a counter creature to Uk'Otoa?? Or something?? What does that mean, Matt Mercer????

summary: Back at it again with some more pictures from portsmouth comic con of my Jester cosplay! When I made this, I had such a crazy...
caption: Back at it again with some more pictures from portsmouth comic con of my Jester cosplay! When I made this, I had such a crazy time trying to figure out how everything would come together– making my first corset was definitely a process that involved some blood and a lot of tears. But I’m so proud of how it turned out, and I’m still so amazed that I won the cosplay competition!

summary: Since I’ve seen a lot of panicking about Astrid and the letter having the name Lavorre attached to it with relation to Marion...
body:
Since I’ve seen a lot of panicking about Astrid and the letter having the name Lavorre attached to it with relation to Marion and Luke/Yeza should they get there. I’m gonna put forward a few options as to the likelihood of the connection being made:

Option 1: Lavorre is a relatively common surname. The Lavorre could be anyone or just a name someone made up in the minds of the Academy. No threat to Marion or Nott’s Family

Option 2: Lavorre is an uncommon surname but only a select few (Jester, Blud, etc.) know the Ruby’s actual name. Minimal threat to Marion and Nott’s Family

Option 3: Uncommon surname, Real name known to clients. Probably the highest risk of connection, could be misconstrued as blackmail from one client to another instead of any connection to Marion.

Option 4: Uncommon surname, real name is widely known. Minimal threat of connection. Making that leap would be like receiving a scam letter from John Obama and assuming there’s a connection there.


I would say Marion, and Luke and Yeza once they get there, are as of this moment not in any real danger from the Cerberus Assembly going to Nicodranas to figure out what they’re doing.

tags: YEZA KNOWS TOO MUCH ABOUT THE M9 AND XHORHAS
summary: Okay let me get this straight... So Jester and Nott sent a letter to Astrid at the academy... Astrid is most likely became an...
body:
Okay let me get this straight…

So Jester and Nott sent a letter to Astrid at the academy… Astrid is most likely became an assassin, and nobody should know she exists, right? Now Jester and Nott sent the letter signing it with the name Lavorre. 

They go investigate and find out about Marion, and then Jester.

Okay but listen…

The M9 wants to send Yeza to the same place where the Academy will probably go to investigate at one point or another.

So if the Academy does reach Marion, they WILL find Yeza. The same Yeza who was working for the Academy helping them with the dodecahedron. 

Even if Yeza refuses to tell them anything, Trent have ways to extract information from him…

THIS IS BAD

MISSION ABORT

reblog.comment:
Okay let me get this straight…

So Jester and Nott sent a letter to Astrid at the academy… Astrid is most likely became an assassin, and nobody should know she exists, right? Now Jester and Nott sent the letter signing it with the name Lavorre. 

They go investigate and find out about Marion, and then Jester.

Okay but listen…

The M9 wants to send Yeza to the same place where the Academy will probably go to investigate at one point or another.

So if the Academy does reach Marion, they WILL find Yeza. The same Yeza who was working for the Academy helping them with the dodecahedron. 

Even if Yeza refuses to tell them anything, Trent have ways to extract information from him…

THIS IS BAD

MISSION ABORT

summary:
Blaming Caleb as secretive for Nott & Jester going behind his back with the Astrid letter is certainly a take.
Like, while I get...
body:
Blaming Caleb as secretive for Nott & Jester going behind his back with the Astrid letter is certainly a take.

Like, while I get it was well intentioned, but maybe Nott & Jester should’ve asked about her before shooting off a Nigerian Prince letter to someone they know nothing about.

reblog.comment:

Like, while I get it was well intentioned, but maybe Nott & Jester should’ve asked about her before shooting off a Nigerian Prince letter to someone they know nothing about.

trail.content:
Blaming Caleb as secretive for Nott & Jester going behind his back with the Astrid letter is certainly a take.

Like, while I get it was well intentioned, but maybe Nott & Jester should’ve asked about her before shooting off a Nigerian Prince letter to someone they know nothing about.
